messages.message:
<!subteam^SQ3KR3V17> I just merged https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/14135 which should hopefully fix most of the yapf auto-reformatting that's been happening with python code since we bumped the version of yapf. Can you rebase your PR branches and see if it reverts any re-formatting that was happening? It doesn't fix everything unfortunately, but should revert a lot of the changes.

Also let me know if you don't see the flags being applied. I set the flags only in .style.yapf and removed them from .pre-commit-config.yaml. It worked fine for me but @Heymian said her precommit wasn't picking up the config.

i’m seeing this `1 file changed, 270 insertions(+), 262 deletions(-)` for a file where i changed max ~10 lines and i’m on most up to date master. is this supposed to happen? seems like it should be reformatting less?

@lydia https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/14144

but I managed another PR where it doesn’t happen: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/14143
This one from @Thomas Qin also seems to still have some line wrapping differences. https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/14140/files The configs definitely fixed most of it though!
@Felicia it's because it was reformatted in recent commits with the new version, and is now undoing the changes
hmm both prs should show the differences - maybe the one that doesn't change is not rebased on master?
the one that doesn’t change is a cherry pick (probably from a branch not rebased on master)

~i’m assuming the one with lots of changes is the preferred one so i’ll add you as a reviewer on there~
never mind!
